info.title: Railsr v2 API
info.description:
Explore our technical documentation. Our library of endpoints gives you everything you need to build your embedded financial experience.

To get your OAuth Client or API Key, Sign Up or Sign In [here](https://dashboard.railsr.com/).

get.description:
This endpoint retrieves a collection of endusers. It allows you to fetch a list of all endusers associated with your account. You can use pagination parameters to control the number of results returned.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:endusers.readonly`, `urn:railsr:endusers`

otherNotes.description: When “other” type is used then this field becomes mandatory to explain account usage in free text.
otherNotes.title: accountUsage/otherNotes

accountUsage.description: Details about how the account will be used.
accountUsage.title: person/accountUsage

citizenships.description: List of countries where the person holds citizenship. Each country should be provided as an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.
citizenships.title: person/citizenships

riskScore.description: Assessed risk level of the enduser.
riskScore.title: enduser/riskScore

dateOfBirth.description: Associated person's date of birth in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD). No time or timezone information.
dateOfBirth.title: person/dateOfBirth

email.description: Email address. Must be a valid email.
email.title: email/email

placeOfBirthCountry.description: Country where the enduser was born, provided as an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Additionally allows former country codes as an ISO 3166-3 alpha-2 code
placeOfBirthCountry.title: person/placeOfBirthCountry

telephone.description: Phone number. Cannot start with 0 and without '+' sign (e.g., 1012555123).
telephone.title: telephone/telephone

metadata.description: Additional custom metadata about the enduser. Key-value pairs for custom data.
metadata.title: enduser/metadata

type.description: Type of enduser. Must be "person" for this schema.
type.title: person/type

placeOfBirthCity.description: City where the enduser was born.
placeOfBirthCity.title: person/placeOfBirthCity

isPep.description: Indicates if the associated person is a Politically Exposed Person. Must be either true or false.
isPep.title: person/isPep

vulnerableDetails.description: Details about the enduser's vulnerability status, if applicable
vulnerableDetails.title: person/vulnerableDetails

range.description: Range of the expected transaction volumes.
range.title: expectedVolumePerson/range

type.description: Define frequency for the range.
type.title: expectedVolume/type

currency.description: Currency of expected transaction volumes. Provided as an ISO 4217 currency code.
currency.title: expectedVolume/currency

expectedVolume.description: Expected transaction volume for the account.
expectedVolume.title: person/expectedVolume

employmentStatus.description: Current employment status of the enduser.
employmentStatus.title: person/employmentStatus

houseNumber.description: House number or building name of residence.
houseNumber.title: address/houseNumber

legalStatusOfEntity.description: Details the legal status of the enduser entity in cases where this data cannot be collected from a publicly accessible registry. Required for company types: nonProfit, communityInterest, internationalNGO
legalStatusOfEntity.title: company/legalStatusOfEntity

registrationName.description: Official registered name of the company.
registrationName.title: company/registrationName

tradingNames.description: List of trading names used by the company. Each trading name can have a maximum 200 characters.
tradingNames.title: company/tradingNames

otherNotes.description: When “other” type is used then this field becomes mandatory to explain account usage in free text.
otherNotes.title: accountUsage/otherNotes

accountUsage.description: Details about how the account will be used.
accountUsage.title: company/accountUsage

registeredAt.description: Date of company registration in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD). Required for company types: private, public, partnership, nonProfit, communityInterest.
registeredAt.title: company/registeredAt

riskScore.description: Assessed risk level of the enduser.
riskScore.title: enduser/riskScore

website.description: Company's official website URL. Must be a valid URL. Required for company types: public, internationalNGO.
website.title: company/website

email.description: Email address. Must be a valid email.
email.title: email/email

businessNatures.description: List of Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) codes representing the company's business activities. Codes can be found at https://resources.companieshouse.gov.uk/sic/. Required for company types: private, public, soleTrader, partnership.
businessNatures.title: company/businessNatures

charitableBeneficiaries.description: Description of beneficiary groups that benefit from this entity. Required for company type: nonProfit.
charitableBeneficiaries.title: company/charitableBeneficiaries

telephone.description: Phone number. Cannot start with 0 and without '+' sign (e.g., 1012555123).
telephone.title: telephone/telephone

metadata.description: Additional custom metadata about the enduser. Key-value pairs for custom data.
metadata.title: enduser/metadata

nonBusinessNature.description: Description of activities not covered by SIC codes. Required for company types: nonProfit, communityInterest, internationalNGO.
nonBusinessNature.title: company/nonBusinessNature

houseNumber.description: House number or building name of residence.
houseNumber.title: address/houseNumber

type.description: Type of enduser. Must be "company" for this schema.
type.title: company/type

range.description: Range of the expected transaction volumes.
range.title: expectedVolumeCompany/range

type.description: Define frequency for the range.
type.title: expectedVolume/type

currency.description: Currency of expected transaction volumes. Provided as an ISO 4217 currency code.
currency.title: expectedVolume/currency

expectedVolume.description: Expected transaction volume for the account.
expectedVolume.title: company/expectedVolume

registrationNumber.description: Official company registration number. Required for company types: private, public, partnership, nonProfit.
registrationNumber.title: company/registrationNumber

houseNumber.description: House number or building name of residence.
houseNumber.title: address/houseNumber

legalFormOfPartnership.description: Details legal form of the partnership. This will effect the type of associated persons which are expected to be seen for partnership. Required for company type: partnership
legalFormOfPartnership.title: company/legalFormOfPartnership

post.description:
This endpoint creates a new enduser. It allows you to submit the required information to register either a natural person or a company as an enduser in the system. The type of enduser (person or company) is determined by the data submitted.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:endusers`

get.description:
This endpoint retrieves detailed information about a specific enduser. By providing the unique identifier of an enduser, you can fetch all the stored data associated with that particular enduser, whether it's a person or a company.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:endusers.readonly`, `urn:railsr:endusers`

otherNotes.description: When “other” type is used then this field becomes mandatory to explain account usage in free text.
otherNotes.title: accountUsage/otherNotes

accountUsage.description: Details about how the account will be used.
accountUsage.title: person/accountUsage

citizenships.description: List of countries where the person holds citizenship. Each country should be provided as an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.
citizenships.title: person/citizenships

riskScore.description: Assessed risk level of the enduser.
riskScore.title: enduser/riskScore

dateOfBirth.description: Associated person's date of birth in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD). No time or timezone information.
dateOfBirth.title: person/dateOfBirth

email.description: Email address. Must be a valid email.
email.title: email/email

put.description:
This endpoint updates the information of an existing enduser. It allows you to modify the details of a specific enduser by submitting updated data. This can be used to keep enduser information current. Additionally, this endpoint is used to migrate endusers from v1 to v2. For more information on the migration process, please refer to [Enduser migration guide](https://docs.railsr.com/docs/guides/1057978f81305-enduser-migration-into-v2)

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:endusers`

get.description:
Get associated persons collection for enduser

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:endusers.readonly`, `urn:railsr:endusers`

citizenships.title: associated-person/citizenships

percentageOwnership.description: Percentage of ownership. Must be between 0 and 100, with up to two decimal places of precision.
percentageOwnership.title: associated-person/percentageOwnership

dateOfBirth.description: Associated person's date of birth in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD). No time or timezone information.

middleNames.title: associated-person/middleNames

isPep.title: associated-person/isPep

houseNumber.description: House number or building name of residence.
houseNumber.title: address/houseNumber

get.description:
This endpoint retrieves a specific associated person of a company enduser. By providing both the enduser ID and the associated person ID, you can fetch all stored data for that particular individual, including their role, contact details, and other relevant information.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:endusers.readonly`, `urn:railsr:endusers`

citizenships.description: List of countries where the associated person holds citizenship. Each country should be provided as an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.
citizenships.title: associated-person/citizenships

percentageOwnership.description: Percentage of ownership. Must be between 0 and 100, with up to two decimal places of precision.
percentageOwnership.title: associated-person/percentageOwnership

dateOfBirth.description: Associated person's date of birth in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD). No time or timezone information.
dateOfBirth.title: associated-person/dateOfBirth

email.description: Email address. Must be a valid email.
email.title: email/email

types.description: Relationship of the associated person with the company
types.title: associated-person/types

firstName.description: Associated person's first name. Maximum 200 characters.
firstName.title: associated-person/firstName

middleNames.description: Associated person's middle name(s), if any.
middleNames.title: associated-person/middleNames

isPep.description: Indicates if the associated person is a Politically Exposed Person. Must be either true or false.
isPep.title: associated-person/isPep

houseNumber.description: House number or building name of residence.
houseNumber.title: address/houseNumber

put.description:
This endpoint updates the information of an existing associated person for a company enduser. It allows you to modify the details of a specific individual, keeping their information up to date. This can be used to reflect changes in roles, contact details, or other relevant information.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:endusers`

post.description:
This endpoint marks associated person as removed from a company enduser. Removal is soft and even removed associated persons can be fetched, but once they become inactive there is no need to update their details to have them up to date.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:endusers`

Search KYC results.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:kyc`, `urn:railsr:kyc.readonly`

`idempotency-key` header is not supported for this endpoint.

Create KYC result with related documents for a specified enduser.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:kyc`

`idempotency-key` header is not supported for this endpoint.

Submit KYC result once necessary files are uploaded.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:kyc`

`idempotency-key` header is not supported for this endpoint.

get.description:
Get a single KYC result by id.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:kyc`, `urn:railsr:kyc.readonly`

put.description:
Upload file of a specified KYC result document. Maximum file size is 20MB.

Subsequent uploads for the same document will overwrite previously uploaded files.

File cannot be uploaded if previously uploaded file for the same document is being processed or KYC result is already submitted.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:kyc`

get.description:
Download file of specified KYC result document.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:kyc`, `urn:railsr:kyc.readonly`

Gets all notifications subscriptions for a customer.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:notifications.readonly`, `urn:railsr:notifications`

post.description:
Creates notifications subscription for a customer.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:notifications`

get.description:
Gets notifications subscription for a customer.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:notifications.readonly`, `urn:railsr:notifications`

put.description:
Updates notifications subscription for a customer.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:notifications`

delete.description:
Removes notifications subscription for a customer.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:notifications`

post.description:
Send verify request to subscription url with "webhook-test" type.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:notifications.readonly`, `urn:railsr:notifications`

get.description:
Retrieves subscription retry policy. If never updated will return default system policy.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:notifications.readonly`, `urn:railsr:notifications`

put.description:
Replaces subscription retry policy with new one.

OAuth scopes: `urn:railsr:notifications`

type.description: The type of address verification document. Must be one of: "bankStatement", "utilityBill", "taxLetter", "driversLicenseFront" (GB only), "driversLicenseBack" (GB only), "counterpartDriversLicense" (GB only).

addressVerificationDocumentInput.description: Address verification document. Required for both CDD and EDD (unless electronic verification is completed).

addressVerificationDocumentInputAddressD.description: UK driving license showing current address. Both front and back required.

expiryDate.description: The expiry date of the document. Should be in ISO 8601 date format (YYYY-MM-DD).

addressVerificationDocumentInputAddressD.description: UK driving license showing current address. Both front and back required.

summary.description: A summary describing document more specifically.

documentInput.description: Represents a document being submitted. A summary for a document can be provided, or it can be left empty.

provider.description: The name of the provider that KYC check. Should be a reputable, independent third-party supplier.

electronicVerificationDocumentInput.description: Contains either KYC check report or 2+2 identity verification check for natural person. When 2+2 check is provided for enduser natural person, liveness check should also be provided.

summary.description: A single summary describing all provided documents for source of funds or source of wealth.

documents.description: A collection of document objects. At least one document must be submitted.

financialDocumentInput.description: Financial documents that help to understand the source of funds and source of wealth.

financialDocumentsInput.description: Financial documents related to the KYC. Mandatory for EDD.

geoPoint.description: Geographic location where the KYC process was completed.

articlesOfAssociation.description: Documents representing the company's articles of association.

companyStructure.description: Documents detailing the company's organizational structure.

otherGoverningDocuments.description: Additional governing documents that are relevant for KYC.

governanceDocumentsInput.description: Governance documents related to the company.

type.description: The type of identity verification. Must be one of: "livenessVideo", "livenessImage", or "documentsVerification".

identityVerificationDocumentInput.description: KYC-result verification document and liveness checks. Mandatory for all due diligence levels to verify that the person providing documents is real and living.

reference.description: Unique reference number for the verification.

provider.description: Name of the third-party service provider.

screeningDate.description: Date of the verification (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD).

identityVerificationDocumentInputDocumen.description: KYC-result verification document that is provided from KYC suppliers.

receiveDate.description: The date when the liveness check was performed. Should be in ISO 8601 date format (YYYY-MM-DD).

identityVerificationDocumentInputImage.description: Set of photos of the individual to prove they are a real, living person.

receiveDate.description: The date when the liveness check was performed. Should be in ISO 8601 date format (YYYY-MM-DD).

identityVerificationDocumentInputVideo.description: Short video recording of the individual to prove they are a real, living person.

associatedPersonId.description: Unique identifier for the associated person.

dueDiligenceLevel.description: The level of due diligence performed for enduser. Must be one of 'customer' (CDD), or 'enhanced' (EDD).

ipAddress.description: The IP address from which the KYC process was completed. Should be a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.

deviceId.description: Unique identifier for the device used during the KYC process (e.g., IMEI number).

completedAt.description: The date when the KYC process was completed. Must be in ISO 8601 format (yyyy-MM-dd).

items.description: Photo Id documents. At least one document with photo ID must be submitted for CDD and EDD (unless electronic verification is completed). If ID card or driving license is used, both front and back must be captured and submitted. Residence permit is mandatory if citizenship is indicated as outside of jurisdiction.

apiKeyAuth.name: Authorization
apiKeyAuth.description: Prepend the case-sensitive scheme `API-Key` to the beginning of your API key, i.e. `Authorization: API-Key <API key>`.

bearerAuth.description: Bearer token, obtained from Railsr OAuth Authorization Server.
